ABBREVIATION_DEF.description: Check if terms are defined with abbreviations on first use
ABBREVIATION_DEF.good_example: The User Requirement Specification (URS) document outlines the functional needs.
ABBREVIATION_DEF.bad_example: The URS document outlines the functional needs.
ABBREVIATION_DEF.instruction: Ensure technical terms are expanded with abbreviation in parentheses on first use.

BLANK_JUSTIFICATION.description: Blank sections must have 'Not Applicable' with justification
BLANK_JUSTIFICATION.good_example: Not Applicable - This section is not relevant for cloud-based deployments.
BLANK_JUSTIFICATION.instruction: Any blank or N/A entry must include a clear justification explaining why it's not applicable.

AUTHOR_NOT_REVIEWER.good_example: Author: John Smith | Reviewer: Jane Doe | Approver: Bob Johnson
AUTHOR_NOT_REVIEWER.bad_example: Author: John Smith | Reviewer: John Smith | Approver: Jane Doe
AUTHOR_NOT_REVIEWER.instruction: Ensure the document author is not listed as a reviewer or approver to maintain objectivity.

REFERENCES_CHECK.good_example: Reference: SOP-QA-001 Quality Assurance Procedures v2.3
REFERENCES_CHECK.instruction: All references to SOPs, WPs, or artifacts must include the control number or document ID.

ACRONYMS_SECTION.description: Acronyms section must be in alphabetical order
ACRONYMS_SECTION.good_example:
API - Application Programming Interface
GDP - Good Documentation Practice
SOP - Standard Operating Procedure
ACRONYMS_SECTION.bad_example:
GDP - Good Documentation Practice
API - Application Programming Interface
SOP - Standard Operating Procedure
ACRONYMS_SECTION.instruction: List all acronyms in alphabetical order in the Acronyms & Definitions section.

BULLET_PERIODS.description: Bullet points should end with periods
BULLET_PERIODS.good_example:
• First item.
• Second item.
• Third item.
BULLET_PERIODS.bad_example:
• First item
• Second item
• Third item
BULLET_PERIODS.instruction: Add a period at the end of each bullet point for consistency.

AMBIGUOUS_LANGUAGE.description: Avoid ambiguous terms like 'should', 'might', 'could' in requirements
AMBIGUOUS_LANGUAGE.good_example: The system must generate an audit trail for all critical actions.
AMBIGUOUS_LANGUAGE.bad_example: The system should generate an audit trail for critical actions.
AMBIGUOUS_LANGUAGE.instruction: Use definitive language ('must', 'shall') for requirements. Avoid 'should', 'might', 'could', 'may'.

DATA_INTEGRITY_ALCOA.description: Ensure ALCOA+ principles (Attributable, Legible, Contemporaneous, Original, Accurate)
DATA_INTEGRITY_ALCOA.instruction: All actions must be attributable and contemporaneous. Ensure signatures/initials are accompanied by a date.

VERSION_CONTROL.description: Document version must match the revision history
VERSION_CONTROL.good_example: Header: Version 2.0 | Revision History: v2.0 - Final Release
VERSION_CONTROL.bad_example: Header: Version 2.0 | Revision History: v1.5 - Draft
VERSION_CONTROL.instruction: Ensure the document version in the header/footer matches the latest entry in the revision history.

UNRESOLVED_COMMENTS.description: No unresolved comments or track changes should be present
UNRESOLVED_COMMENTS.instruction: Ensure there are no unresolved comments, TBDs, or track changes in the final document.

LOGICAL_CONTRADICTION.description: Ensure consistency in numerical values and requirements across sections
LOGICAL_CONTRADICTION.good_example:
Section 3: Data retention is 5 years.
Section 8: Archives are kept for 5 years.
LOGICAL_CONTRADICTION.bad_example:
Section 3: Data retention is 5 years.
Section 8: Archives are kept for 3 years.
LOGICAL_CONTRADICTION.instruction: Flag any contradictions in numbers, dates, or requirements between different sections of the document.

TECHNICAL_ACCURACY.description: Distinguish between technical terminology and spelling errors
TECHNICAL_ACCURACY.good_example: The kubectl command configures the K8s cluster via API.
TECHNICAL_ACCURACY.bad_example: The kubectl command configures the K8s cluster via API (Flagged as typo).
TECHNICAL_ACCURACY.instruction: Do not flag standard technical terms (e.g., lowercase CLI commands, acronyms) as spelling errors. Only flag genuine typos.

MISSING_CONTEXT.description: Ensure sufficient context for high-level compliance or technical statements
MISSING_CONTEXT.good_example: Maintain ISO 27001 compliance through quarterly internal audits and annual external certification updates performed by [Team].
MISSING_CONTEXT.bad_example: Maintain ISO 27001 compliance for information security.
MISSING_CONTEXT.instruction: Flag statements that are too broad or lack 'how' context, especially regarding compliance, audits, or technical migrations.

AMBIGUOUS_REQUIREMENT.description: Flag keywords like 'seamless' or 'intuitive' that lack measurable metrics
AMBIGUOUS_REQUIREMENT.good_example: Ensure migration with maximum 2-hour downtime and 100% data integrity verification.
AMBIGUOUS_REQUIREMENT.bad_example: Ensure seamless migration from the existing platform.
AMBIGUOUS_REQUIREMENT.instruction: Identify qualitative adjectives ('seamless', 'intuitive', 'fast') and request quantitative metrics instead.
